good game

游戏画面表现力及战斗手感：毕竟是13年的老游戏了，画面和FPS的手感以现在的目光来看只能是一个略强于及格的水平（WIN10有恶性闪退BUG，触发条件不明）。抛去画质略显落后不说，画风和美工对于时代刻画的是比较到位的：集市上的种种别出心裁的小游戏，种种富有十八世纪航海精神特色的展出，对于“流淌着奶与蜜”的烈火烹油般的天空城市的刻画还是很到位的。皮影戏画风的镇压义和团也称得上别出心裁；以及代表着贫穷，饥饿，愤怒与抱团（并不算团结，不知道该怎么描述它）的贫民窟，画风一改绮丽，有森然魄动之感。
剧情：生化奇兵不愧为最经常被提名第九艺术的游戏之一。多主角，多主线，多平行世界互相影响，散而不乱的叙事方式把三部曲的剧情拉到了名著级别，让人惊艳的高度。伴随主线的NPC也都是无政府乌托邦革命军和安娜其资本主义中的经典形象；种族主义刽子手，一切权力归利维坦的洗脑宣传，伪善的女革命军官等。 本片的底色是悲剧，伊丽莎白几近懦弱的圣母和无条件相信别人使得她困在一次又一次的循环和历史必然里面；假若她有Atlas的一点点心狠手辣，或者daicy的一点点通透洞察，或者comstock的1%的组织和宣传能力，踏平销魂城可能比较困难，但是绝不会落得一个任人摆布的被动局面，可惜这对于一个从小囚禁起来没有任何社会关系的素人而言几近于天方夜谭，也许这就是伊丽莎白悲剧的内核所在，她从出生开始就是一个错误，甚至不会有一个哪怕形式上的世俗的解决手段。她超脱于世界而存在，世界，或者说其他人的生活方式，之于她而言几是一个巴黎一样的只能在书中体验的一个幻想——可是伊丽莎白却恰恰具有世俗意义上的美好品质，这正是戏剧式的冲突所在。

J'étais à la recherche d'un jeu qui te fait voyager...  et puis je suis tombé sur se jeu qui est juste, incroyable ! Mes première heures de jeu dessus mon montré que l'univers est très bien fait et détaillé !  Au début tu as juste envie d'explorer la ville plutôt que de faire l'aventure. 
Parlons des graphismes : le jeu est sortit en 2013 alors que pour moi j'avais l'impression que c'était de 2018 ! Le jeu est juste magnifique !  Croyez moi se n'est pas les graphismes qui vont vous dérangez

I devoured the first two Titles and 100% both in like two months and loved every second of it, even the DLCs, but Infinite... I am not entirely sure why, but I feel very conflicted about this game;

first of all it's a great game and I enjoyed the time I spent on beating it even a second time with the challenge of the 1999 mode! It has an interesting cast of characters that just pull you into the story, rooting for them and suffering with them. The first escort mission in all my life playing games that did not feel like a massive chore. Also it has a beautiful setting with an independant city state flying high in the skies ruled by both fate and faith deeply intertwined; fascinating as well as hecka gross. And lastly the game spoils you with a fast-paced combat system fully loaded with action and a touch of finesse to it. Or at least that's what you need when you try to get the two 1999 mode achievements.

BUT, and that's what confuses me deeply, as awesome as the game is, it kinda itches me the wrong way how all parts of the game try to fit together:

For example the character of Daisy Fitzroy. i had such high hopes that she and her revolution was gonna be a great asset to the story, but after finishing the game and having met the person and heard so many voxophones about her I still feel like I don't know the character at all. And the same applies to Fink, I mean he talks to you, hires you, is obnoxious as hell and then somehow nothing becomes of it.
And thinking back that is because both characters are completely overshadowed by Elizabeths opening of the rifts that always pushed the story too fast too far ahead and, and that's my point exactly here, were supposed to move the story ahead, but in the end only felt like tricks to push you right into the next battle without the proper reasoning.

While I'm at it, I liked the battle system, but it never felt like battling your way through an actual city. In the beginning when you made your way to Monument Island over the rooftops and could actually enter some buildings it gave off such great vibes, but later on it more and more felt like moving from one arena to the other and thus it kinda unfortunately lost that feeling.

And then there was the decision-making problem. I mean, I get why in a game that revolves around the theory that all possibilites are supposed to deliver you equally to the same end, the pure existence of choice would work against the plot. But then why give you the illusion of choice in the first place? That is just mean.

Lastly... multiverse, really? This might be just a personal issue, but multiverse theory is one of the three cheapest ways to explain plot. I mean, I understand that it's based on Elizabeth's powers, but it also explains Elizabeth's powers, which makes sense by not making sense, because multiverse can explain literally anything.
Confusing

great story

Ah, Bioshock Infinite. Honestly after playing it and the dlc over again for the third time, and after the extremely cool presentation wears off and you make your way through Columbia, it becomes a pretty average game. The combat gets old very quickly and it becomes a lot of going to various arenas to kill the baddies while Elizabeth helps out.

The story is supposed to be the strength here but personally I'm not too sure how it all is supposed to make sense, given all the parallel universes introduced later in the very end game.

It is still a fine game and the Burial at Sea dlc is definitely worth playing to see how the original Bioshock is set up. But after the initial E3 showing that I still remember all these years later, I think what we finally got was quite underwhelming.

Also the Clash in the Clouds dlc is very mediocre. Just some arenas to kill waves of baddies over and over. And since the combat isn't exactly Quake, this kinda sucks and feels odd as to why its here but it is there if you want.

7 out of 10

塑造了一座浮于天上的绝美城市，但内核却是烂到了骨子里，一言难尽

在这里，找工作的方式是参加一场拍卖，轮番叫价，谁要的工钱最少谁来干，嫌少？不好意思，有的是人想干；为了一份工作，工人之间会大打出手，倒地的不省人事，打赢的就去工作；我不知道该不该叫他们工贼，因为他们背后确确实实是妻子和儿女。还有些找不到工作的家庭，只能拖儿带女露宿在贫民窟，为了一口吃的不惜拼上性命

从头到尾，整场拍卖会荒唐至极，可在当今环境下又真实得可拍

最近一直在参加春招，参加了好多面试，但见过的公司越多，越对自己的未来感到绝望；惯性加班，到点不走仿佛是各个行业的潜规则，什么大小周在他们眼里也是理所应当；最后却因为害怕被刷，犹犹豫豫才敢问出那句

“公司加班多吗”

近几个月又有某个大厂员工猝死的新闻，房贷三十年，究竟是谁去加在这些年轻人身上的？？

想到这里，我一枪崩掉了拍卖会的主持人，可他也不过是资本家的一条狗而已，杀了他又能有什么作用呢

天越来越黑了，泪水浸满眼眶，哀民生之多艰

Maybe in an alternate reality this is a good game.

+ good sound / music
+ interesting setting
+ columbia feels more alive than rapture
+ sky lines are a cool idea with okayish implementation

- poorly written story with plot holes
- protagonists are stupid
- bad weapon handling
- you are only allowed to carry 2 weapons at a time
- useless weapon upgrading system due to the 2 weapons issue
- ammo management is unnecessary hard due to the 2 weapons issue
- vigors are overlapping and storywise there is no real need for them
- enemy variation is meh
- replaced good mechanics from the previous bioshocks with boring button press interactions
- core gameplay is boring, repetetive and tiring

Третій Біошок трохи відрізняється від попередників - цього рази ми не в підводному світі, а в літаючому місті, тож тепер це шутер з більш відкритим світом, і як завжди з елементами RPG. Хоча цього разу елементів RPG ну дуже мало і вони не сильно впливають на геймплей. Перестрілки десь як в попередніх частинах - купа зброї, [strike]плазміди[/strike]суперсили, вороги, і тепер ще додатково є Небесні Лінії, що допомагають буквально літати на полі бою та швидко переміщуватися рівнями. Різноманіття зброї хоч і велике, та відмінності від зброї невеликі, вороги одноманітні, а сили не надто потужні, хоч і допомагають. Загалом перестрілки трохи набридають до кінця гри.
Графіка взагалі не дуже - аж надто мильна й розмазана, хоч і на свій час була гарною.
Але це все не важливе, найважливіше тут - сюжет. Він дуже цікавий, хоч і складний, і я б навіть сказав - геніальний. І по сюжету в нас є компаньйон - дівчина Елізабет, гарна, цікава, в бою допомагає й найголовніше - не мішає, як то часто буває.
А ще є DLC, які розставляють крапки над "і". Але перша частина DLC достобіса складна, порівнюючи з основною грою
Гру загалом дуже рекомендую.

BioShock: Infinite is a very passable shooter with great visuals and art direction.

My problems with the game are that the gun play can feel generic at times, and that the story is paced quite awfully and doesn't provide a satisfying conclusion to either the game or the franchise as a whole, partly due to how confusing it is.

These problems I have are obviously not present during the entire game, as there are definitely moments with genuinely memorable game-play, characters or writing, such as in the Hall of Heroes, which is most likely the highlight of this game for me.

So is this game worth playing? If you get it with the franchise bundle or if its on sale less than ten dollars then sure, although if you where a fan of the previous entries in the series you might be a tad bit dissapointed.

Keep in mind that this is just my opinion however, and that this review can be taken with a grain of salt if you so wish to approach it that way.

I miss when this game was a metaphor for slavery. I miss when Father Comstock was just a simple racist patriot who believed in violence as a form of democracy. I miss when all I had to do was rescue a girl and kill an old man, just like the games before it such as "Skylanders" and "Super Mario Bros". 
However, at the end of the game you find out: You are Booker Dewitt and also Father Comstock (Oh, spoilers by the way, sorry) and there are infinite timelines that get thinner as they stray from our reality, which isn't actually our reality because there are multiple realities and the girl can open space portals into other dimensions called tears which act as deus ex machina and also Comstock killed his wife -no sorry, Daisy Fitzroy killed his wife and plus you were involved in a battle called the battle of Wounded Dog or Wolf or Hound, I can't remember, actually I think it was Wounded Cow and you want to be baptized to be cleansed of your sins and there are two time god characters who pop in and out and give you upgrades and kidnap your baby (who you later find out is actually the girl) and also I'm just remembering this guy named "Finkton" who you never actually meet but is kinda a big deal for like half of the game and also there is this battle in China and this guy named Chen Lin who is the gunsmith who is dead in one reality but also alive in some others (actually, Chen Lin is where the story takes a nose dive so just play to Chen Lin and then immediately quit and see if you can get a Steam refund). 
Anyway, game's fun, good gameplay.

7/10
buenardo

A saga that is continually a blast, it is no shock that the third in this trilogy over performs as a First-Person Shooter. This genre being the last on my list to ever explore, BioShock has blown away my expectations of what it's like to loot-and-shoot or spray-and-pray. With multiple levels of difficult, I wouldn't mind playing this over and mastering a story line that has many opportunities for success (and failure.) 10/10 recommend. I only wish we had more water elements like the first two, but the music is still a leading playlist for my most listened music.

Bom sendo sincero meu favorito de longe da trio apesar que  o jogo realmente fica excessivamente viajado e complexo comparando aos jogos anteriores aqui temos implementação de  exploração muito mais forte do que nos anteriores oque ao meu ver e algo muito positivo o level designe ainda e simples na maior parte e so andar e atirar porem sinceramente esse jogo te cativa com facilidade e a mecânica de tiro esta bem mais  polida assim como a física do jogo e a hud esta um pouco melhor sem falar nos criativos trilhos bom   parando por aqui os elogios. vamos aos pontos negativos 
pouca interatividade do ambiente com os poderes coisa que nos anteriores era bem melhor 
porque diabos não ter save ou quick save e completamente estupido ainda mais que eu cheguei a ficar em preso em algum objeto em 3 ocasiões perdendo assim 1 hora de jogo facilmente  save 1000 melhor que auto save paz olha sinceramente não tenho muito a reclamar deste jogo.
bom vamos as conclusões  o jogo tem uma historia que por mais confusa  e complexa que seja te emociona pelo menos foi assim comigo e que maneja muito bem o ar de mistério  te fazendo de fato pensar e analisar olha fico no aguardo do 4 caso ele seja lançado nota final 9.0

Can't believe I waited so long to play the final game in this great Trilogy!! BioShock Infinite is a short first person shooter. The story is great and takes place in the early 1900's. It does have similar elements to the first game in the series as you start as a guy who finds himself in a totally new world. The characters are great and feel very natural. The world is gorgeous! At first I was unsure how I'd feel leaving Rapture after 2 games being familiar but Columbia is soo beautiful!
Gameplay is very good. You get guns and super powers just like previous BioShocks which you can upgrade as the game progresses. Combat is great with a new element where you are able to alter your environment to suit your combat style. Tho the powers aren't too dissimilar from the first one, it definitely feels fresh. As the game progresses further, you get a companion in Elizabeth but luckily she *never* gets in the way and you don't have to babysit her. The story is great as it trickles information throughout your exploration of Columbia  and thru cut scenes. There aren't really many bosses just 'large enemies' which you see over and over again. Music is good, graphics are good, story is great, characters are great, combat is decently complex and can be played how you want to play. Short but sweet 8.5/10
